query.question: Can I start accepting payments on my site while my Wix Payments account is still under verification?
query.answer: You can start accepting payments on your site using [Wix Payments](https://support.wix.com/en/article/about-wix-payments) almost immediately. However, we need to verify your identity before your account can be fully activated.

results.answer:
Yes, you can start accepting payments on your site while your Wix Payments account is still under verification. When your account status is "Accepting Payments," customers can complete their purchases successfully on your site. However, during this verification phase, although you can accept payments, you will not be able to receive payouts to your bank account until the verification process is fully completed. 

The verification process involves submitting your personal, business, and bank information, along with documents like a government-issued photo ID and a bank statement. This process may take up to 7 business days. You have 30 days from the time of the first transaction to complete this verification, or your Wix Payments account will be suspended. After the account is active, payouts are then processed as usual.

In summary, you can accept payments right away while your account is under verification, but the ability to receive payouts is only activated upon successful verification completion.

misc_response.original_query: Can I start accepting payments on my site while my Wix Payments account is still under verification?

queries: accepting payments with Wix Payments account under verification

misc_response.aggregation_answer: You can accept payments while your Wix Payments account is under verification, but you cannot receive payouts until verification is complete. You have 30 days to complete verification after the first transaction, and the process may take up to 7 business days.
misc_response.final_answer:
Yes, you can start accepting payments on your site while your Wix Payments account is still under verification. When your account status is "Accepting Payments," customers can complete their purchases successfully on your site. However, during this verification phase, although you can accept payments, you will not be able to receive payouts to your bank account until the verification process is fully completed. 

The verification process involves submitting your personal, business, and bank information, along with documents like a government-issued photo ID and a bank statement. This process may take up to 7 business days. You have 30 days from the time of the first transaction to complete this verification, or your Wix Payments account will be suspended. After the account is active, payouts are then processed as usual.

In summary, you can accept payments right away while your account is under verification, but the ability to receive payouts is only activated upon successful verification completion.

query.question: I am inquiring about purchasing the yearly premium plan for $17.00, which includes a free domain for 1 year. However, the voucher does not show up at checkout. Do I need to purchase the plan first and then will the voucher be available to activate?
query.answer: When you purchase a yearly Premium plan, the free domain voucher is not immediately visible at checkout. Instead, the voucher becomes available after you complete the purchase of the plan. You can then claim the voucher by visiting the [Premium Vouchers page](https://manage.wix.com/account/vouchers?referralAdditionalInfo=%7Btheir) in your Wix account. The voucher is valid for two months from the date of purchase, and you can use it to register a domain for free for one year. If you have already purchased the plan and still do not see the voucher, ensure that you meet all eligibility criteria, such as not having purchased a monthly plan or a domain prior to the plan. If issues persist, you can [contact Wix Customer Care](https://support.wix.com/en/article/contacting-wix-customer-care-for-support) for further assistance.

results.answer:
If you're inquiring about purchasing the yearly premium plan for $17.00 which includes a free domain for one year, the free domain voucher does not appear directly at the checkout stage. Instead, you need to first complete the purchase of your selected yearly premium plan. Upon this initial purchase, the 1 year free domain voucher is then credited to your Wix account. You can view and claim this voucher on the Premium Vouchers page in your Wix account.

The voucher is only included with the first-time purchase of selected yearly or multi-year Premium or Studio plans and is not available for monthly plans, renewals, or upgrades. After purchasing the yearly plan, you have up to two months to redeem the voucher to claim a free domain for one year, with certain domain extensions eligible (like .com, .net, .org, and others).

When you redeem the voucher, you must enter your payment information, but you will not be charged for the first year of the domain subscription. This setup allows Wix to process renewal payments after the free year to keep your domain live. Note that the voucher cannot be applied retroactively to domains purchased before the plan.

In summary, you do not receive the voucher at checkout; you purchase the plan first, then access and activate the free domain voucher from your account afterwards.

When you redeem the voucher, you must enter your payment information, but you will not be charged for the first year of the domain subscription. This setup allows Wix to process renewal payments after the free year to keep your domain live. Note that the voucher cannot be applied retroactively to domains purchased before the plan.

In summary, you do not receive the voucher at checkout; you purchase the plan first, then access and activate the free domain voucher from your account afterwards.

query.question: I'm want to know how much it would cost to upgrade my email plan.
query.answer:
To upgrade your email marketing plan:
[Go to Email Marketing](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Email%20Marketing%20Dashboard&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https://www.wix.com/dashboard/%7B%7BmetaSiteId%7D%7D/shoutout/) in your site's dashboard.  Under Monthly Balance click Upgrade.
  Choose a plan that works best for you and checkout.

results.answer: The cost to upgrade your email plan depends on the type of email plan you have and the provider you are using. For example, if you use Google Workspace for your business email through Wix, upgrading your plan will give you increased storage and more features. The specific costs are not directly listed but you can select a plan that fits your business needs and the payment will be confirmed upon checkout. If you are using Wix's Email Marketing service, you can upgrade your email marketing plan based on the number of emails you plan to send per month and any additional features you want. The free tier allows up to 200 emails per month, but to send more emails, you need to upgrade to a paid plan, with pricing depending on your email volume and selected features. To upgrade, you generally go to your account's Email Marketing dashboard or Business Email page, select the desired upgrade, and complete the purchase. Note that any remaining credit from your existing plan may be applied to your new purchase. Also, the billing cycle usually remains the same upon upgrade (monthly plans to monthly, yearly plans to yearly). No exact pricing numbers were provided in the available information, so for exact costs, you would need to check your provider's upgrade page or dashboard directly. If you want to upgrade other related plans like your website premium plan, those are separate costs and plans.

misc_response.original_query: I'm want to know how much it would cost to upgrade my email plan.
missing_information: Exact pricing details for upgrading email plans with specific providers
misc_response.final_answer: The cost to upgrade your email plan depends on the type of email plan you have and the provider you are using. For example, if you use Google Workspace for your business email through Wix, upgrading your plan will give you increased storage and more features. The specific costs are not directly listed but you can select a plan that fits your business needs and the payment will be confirmed upon checkout. If you are using Wix's Email Marketing service, you can upgrade your email marketing plan based on the number of emails you plan to send per month and any additional features you want. The free tier allows up to 200 emails per month, but to send more emails, you need to upgrade to a paid plan, with pricing depending on your email volume and selected features. To upgrade, you generally go to your account's Email Marketing dashboard or Business Email page, select the desired upgrade, and complete the purchase. Note that any remaining credit from your existing plan may be applied to your new purchase. Also, the billing cycle usually remains the same upon upgrade (monthly plans to monthly, yearly plans to yearly). No exact pricing numbers were provided in the available information, so for exact costs, you would need to check your provider's upgrade page or dashboard directly. If you want to upgrade other related plans like your website premium plan, those are separate costs and plans.

query.question: I want to know if the Wix store function work for selling services instead of just physical goods
query.answer:
Wix Stores gives you all the tools you need to create a sleek, professional online store and grow your eCommerce business.
  
Wix Bookings, however, is an easy-to-use scheduling system that lets your members book and [pay for] (https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-about-getting-paid-online) services online, so you can focus on managing your business. Whether you offer services like workshops, courses, or private sessions, online or in-person, Wix Bookings has you covered.

results.answer:
Wix Stores primarily supports selling physical and digital products with features tailored for shipping, inventory, and payment handling. However, it does not currently allow the complete removal of shipping options even if you intend to sell services instead of goods. For selling services, Wix recommends using Wix Bookings or Wix Events, which are designed to sell services and events without shipping options. 

Additionally, it is possible to sell services as products within Wix Stores by creating a "physical product" listing for a service with a predefined price. This simplifies the purchasing process for clients by allowing you to present services like one-time packages (e.g., a financial plan or legal contract drafting) similar to product sales. However, managing appointments related to these services needs to be done manually through the Booking calendar. 

In summary, if you want a full service-selling setup without shipping, Wix Bookings is the dedicated solution. If you prefer to use Wix Stores to sell services, you can list them as physical products but must handle scheduling separately. This means Wix Stores is not specialized for service sales alone but can be adapted with some manual steps.

queries: Wix store support selling services instead of physical goods

misc_response.final_answer:

However, it does not currently allow the complete removal of shipping options even if you intend to sell services instead of goods. For selling services, Wix recommends using Wix Bookings or Wix Events, which are designed to sell services and events without shipping options. 

Additionally, it is possible to sell services as products within Wix Stores by creating a "physical product" listing for a service with a predefined price. This simplifies the purchasing process for clients by allowing you to present services like one-time packages (e.g., a financial plan or legal contract drafting) similar to product sales. However, managing appointments related to these services needs to be done manually through the Booking calendar. 

In summary, if you want a full service-selling setup without shipping, Wix Bookings is the dedicated solution. If you prefer to use Wix Stores to sell services, you can list them as physical products but must handle scheduling separately. This means Wix Stores is not specialized for service sales alone but can be adapted with some manual steps.

query.question: How can I add discounts to my service prices when customers pay for a plan?
query.answer:
To add discounts to your service prices when customers pay for a plan, you can create discount coupons for your pricing plans. You can choose to offer a price discount or a percentage discount coupon. You can also choose whether your discount coupons apply to a specific plan or to all your pricing plans. Your clients redeem the coupon at checkout to take advantage of the discounted plans. Note: Discount coupons for Pricing Plans cover the plans themselves, but not any setup fees you may have enabled. To create discount coupons for your pricing plans:

1. Go to Pricing Plans in your site's dashboard.
2. Click the More Actions icon at the top.
3. Click Create a coupon.
4. Select the type of coupon you want to offer:
   - $ Discount: Offer a fixed monetary discount amount.
   - % Discount: Offer a percentage discount.
5. Enter the Coupon code clients use to redeem the coupon.
6. Enter the Coupon name for your own records.
7. Click the Apply to drop-down and choose the relevant pricing plan(s):
   - All plans: This is applied to all your available pricing plans.
   - Specific plan: Click the Pricing plan drop-down and select the relevant plan.
8. Choose how the coupon works with your pricing plans:
   - First billing cycle: The coupon offers a one-time discount at the start of the pricing plan.
   - All billing cycles: The coupon offers a recurring discount, every time your client is charged.
   - Custom: You choose how your coupons work with recurring payments (e.g. give a discount for the first 4 billing cycles).
9. Select the dates the coupon is valid between.
10. (Optional) Select the Limit the total number of uses for this coupon checkbox and enter the number of times the coupon can be used.
11. (Optional) Select the Limit to one use per customer checkbox if you want clients to be able to use the coupon only one time.
12. Click Create Coupon.

results.answer:
To add discounts to your service prices for customers who pay for a plan, you can use the Pricing Plans app to create various types of plans including one-time payment plans and recurring payment plans. Within these plans, you can set different pricing options to offer price breaks or reduced prices as discounts to encourage commitment from clients. For example, you could create a plan like a 6-Class Package at a reduced price compared to individual sessions.

Here’s how to add discounts effectively:
1. Create a pricing plan in your website dashboard.
2. Set the plan price lower than your regular service prices to offer a discount.
3. You can also provide additional benefits or access to premium content/services to increase the value of the plan.
4. Adjust the plan’s duration to suit your offering, such as monthly or custom lengths.
5. Promote your discounted plans using coupons designed specifically for your pricing plans to attract more customers.

Editing existing plans allows you to update prices and connected benefits when needed. However, note that changes to prices affect only new purchases; existing customers retain their original plan conditions.

Currently, you cannot add optional extra benefits that customers can choose to include on a plan, but you can connect certain fixed benefits or services to each plan.

In summary, discounts can be integrated by setting discounted prices in your pricing plans, offering package deals, and using coupons with the Pricing Plans app to incentivize paying for plans over individual services.

queries: add discounts to service prices for customers paying for a plan
